bibl.title: CIG IV 8952 Revisited ('Gebel Maktub' near Qasr Ibrim).
bibl.note: Suggests that the dedicatee of the inscription C.I.G. IV, 8952 might have been a subdeacon or a lecturer active in Qasr Ibrim rather than in the diocese of his father.

bibl.title: Nubian Voices. Studies in Christian Nubian Culture

bibl.seg: Adam Łajtar & Jacques van der Vliet, CIG IV 8952 Revisited ('Gebel Maktub' near Qasr Ibrim).

Adam Łajtar & Jacques van der Vliet (edd.), with the assistance of Grzegorz Ochała & Giovanni Ruffini, Nubian Voices. Studies in Christian Nubian Culture = The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume XV (Warsaw, 2011) pp. 121-131, 1 fig.
Suggests that the dedicatee of the inscription C.I.G. IV, 8952 might have been a subdeacon or a lecturer active in Qasr Ibrim rather than in the diocese of his father.
